answerText: Huntington's disease [or HD][10] Huntington's is caused by this trinucleotide repeat in the HTT gene. This sequence of nucleotides codes for glutamine.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | Stanford + LASA A + MIT B | 12 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Symptoms of this neurodegenerative disease generally start to appear in middle age. For 10 points each: [10] Name this autosomal dominant genetic disorder caused by a trinucleotide repeat on chromosome 4. Its symptoms include uncontrolled, jerky body movements and impairment of thinking and memory.
